file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-26-04-04 - CONFIG-2 - LH WARDROBE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LH WARDROBE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH WARDROBE 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the LH wardrobe. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH LH 25-26-04-000-803-A LH WARDROBE OPTION 1 - REMOVAL WARDROBE OPTION 1 AIRCRAFT WITH LH LH WARDROBE OPTION 1 - INSTALLA- 25-26-04-400-803-A WARDROBE OPTION 1 TION AIRCRAFT WITH LH 25-26-04-000-804-A LH WARDROBE OPTION 2 - REMOVAL WARDROBE OPTION 2 AIRCRAFT WITH LH LH WARDROBE OPTION 2 - INSTALLA- 25-26-04-400-804-A WARDROBE OPTION 2 TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 1 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-04-000-803-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH WARDROBE OPTION 1 2. LH WARDROBE OPTION 1 - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the LH wardrobe option 1. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-27-05-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-008-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Make sure that the LH wardrobe is empty. (3) On the air conditioning/pneumatic control panel, installed on the overhead panel, make sure that the PASS CABIN rotary switch is not set to the ATTD position and attach a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ATTD-POSITION tag to it. (4) On the overhead panel, set the EMERG LT switch to OFF position and attach a DO- NOT-MOVE-FROM-OFF tag to it. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (6) Remove the main door curtain assembly (AMM TASK 25-27-05-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 2 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (7) Remove the sealant from the forward portion of the LH wardrobe. J. LH Wardrobe - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-012-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE-HINGED MAIN DOOR (1) Remove the emergency equipment from the LH wardrobe (14). (2) Remove the sidewall fitting covers (10) with the screws (11). (3) Remove the bolts (12) and washers (13) that attach the LH wardrobe (14) to the sidewall track (9). (4) Remove the bolts (2) and washers (3) that attach the LH wardrobe (14) to the track engage fitting assemblies (5) on the floor track (4). CAUTION: THE STEP BELOW MUST BE DONE WITH CARE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE CONDITIONED AIR HOSE (7) AND THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR (1). (5) Lightly move the LH wardrobe (14) to the aisle to get access to the conditioned air hose (7) and the electrical connector (1). (6) Loosen the clamp (6) and remove the conditioned air hose (7) from the skirting lining panel flange (8). (7) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). (8) Remove the LH wardrobe (14). K. LH Wardrobe with Shroud - Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-013-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR (1) Remove the emergency equipment from the LH wardrobe (17). (2) Remove the shroud (4) with the screws (2) and washers (3). (3) Remove the sidewall fitting covers (13) with the screws (14). (4) Remove the bolts (15) and washers (16) that attach the LH wardrobe (17) to the sidewall track (12). (5) Remove the bolts (5) and washers (6) that attach the LH wardrobe (17) to the track engage fitting assemblies (8) on the floor track (7). CAUTION: THE STEP BELOW MUST BE DONE WITH CARE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE CONDITIONED AIR HOSE (9) AND THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR (1). (6) Lightly move the LH wardrobe (17) to the aisle to get access to the conditioned air hose (9) and the electrical connector (1). (7) Loosen the clamp (10) and remove the conditioned air hose (9) from the skirting lining panel flange (11). (8) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 3 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (9) Remove the LH wardrobe (17). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-803-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 4 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

SCREW (4) 3. WASHER (4) C 15. BOLT 4. SHROUD 16. WASHER B DET. A 14. SCREW (2) B 1 12. SIDEWALL 5. BOLT TRACK 6. WASHER 10. CLAMP 13. SIDEWALL 8. TRACK ENGAGE FITTING FITTING ASSEMBLY COVER DET. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-04-400-803-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH WARDROBE OPTION 1 3. LH WARDROBE OPTION 1 - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the LH wardrobe option 1. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION TEMPERATURE CONTROL SYSTEM - OPERATION- AMM TASK 21-60-00-700-801-A/500 AL CHECK AMM TASK 25-27-05-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-21-00-700-801-A/500 PASSENGER CABIN LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST READING AND ATTENDANT CALL LIGHTS (1) - OP- AMM TASK 33-25-00-700-801-A/500 ERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK AIRSTAIRS MAIN DOOR WARNING MESSAGE - OP- AMM TASK 52-73-00-700-801-A/500 ERATIONALLY CHECK SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) RTV 780 (black) Sealant AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-803-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 7 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. LH Wardrobe - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-012-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE-HINGED MAIN DOOR (1) Remove the sealant residues (SRM 51-20-01) from the related area. (2) Put the LH wardrobe (14) in position. (3) Connect the electrical connector (1). (4) Attach the conditioned air hose (7) to the skirting lining panel flange (8) with the clamp (6). (5) Put the LH wardrobe (14) in its installation position. (6) Attach the LH wardrobe (14) to the sidewall track (9) with the bolts (12) and washers (13). (7) Attach the LH wardrobe (14) to the track engage fitting assemblies (5) on the floor track (4) with the bolts (2) and washers (3). (8) Install the sidewall fitting covers (10) with the screws (11). (9) Install the emergency equipment into the LH wardrobe (14). (10) Apply the sealant in the forward portion of the LH wardrobe (SRM 51-20-01). J. LH Wardrobe with Shroud - Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-013-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR (1) Remove the sealant residues (SRM 51-20-01) from the related area. (2) Put the LH wardrobe (17) in position. (3) Connect the electrical connector (1). (4) Attach the conditioned air hose (9) to the skirting lining panel flange (11) with the clamp (10). (5) Put the LH wardrobe (17) in its installation position. (6) Attach the LH wardrobe (17) to the sidewall track (12) with the bolts (15) and washers (16). (7) Attach the LH wardrobe (17) to the track engage fitting assemblies (8) on the floor track (7) with the bolts (5) and washers (6). (8) Install the sidewall fitting covers (13) with the screws (14). (9) Install the shroud (4) with the screws (2) and washers (3). (10) Install the emergency equipment into the LH wardrobe (17). (11) Apply the sealant in the forward portion of the LH wardrobe (SRM 51-20-01). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-803-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 8 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-008-A (1) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ATTD-POSITION tag from the air conditioning/ pneumatic control panel, installed on the overhead panel. (2) Close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (3) On the overhead panel, set the EMERG LT switch to ARM position and remove the DO-NOT-MOVE-FROM-OFF tag from it. (4) Do an operational test of the emergency lights ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). (5) Do an operational test of the attendant call and the Passenger Service Units (PSUs) ( AMM TASK 33-25-00-700-801-A/500). (6) Do an operational test of the cabin lights ( AMM TASK 33-21-00-700-801-A/500). (7) Do an operational test of the cabin temperature control ( AMM TASK 21-60-00-700-801-A/500). (8) Do an operational test of the main door internal control panel ( AMM TASK 52-73-00-700-801-A/500) (except for aircraft with side-hinged main door installed). (9) Install the main door curtain (AMM TASK 25-27-05-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-803-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 9 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-04-000-804-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH WARDROBE OPTION 2 4. LH WARDROBE OPTION 2 - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the LH wardrobe option 2. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-27-05-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-009-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Make sure that the LH wardrobe is empty. (3) On the air conditioning/pneumatic control panel, installed on the overhead panel, make sure that the PASS CABIN rotary switch is not set to the ATTD position and attach a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ATTD-POSITION tag to it. (4) On the overhead panel, set the EMERG LT switch to OFF position and attach a DO- NOT-MOVE-FROM-OFF tag to it. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (6) Remove the main door curtain assembly (AMM TASK 25-27-05-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-804-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 10 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (7) Remove the sealant from the forward portion of the LH wardrobe. J. LH Wardrobe - Removal (Figure 403) SUBTASK 020-014-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE-HINGED MAIN DOOR (1) Remove the emergency equipment from the LH wardrobe (2). (2) Remove the sidewall fitting covers (11) with the screws (12). (3) Remove the bolts (13) and washers (14) that attach the LH wardrobe (2) to the sidewall track (10). (4) Remove the bolts (3) and washers (4) that attach the LH wardrobe (2) to the track engage fitting assemblies (6) on the floor track (5). CAUTION: THE STEP BELOW MUST BE DONE WITH CARE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE CONDITIONED AIR HOSE (8) AND THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR (1). (5) Lightly move the LH wardrobe (2) to the aisle to get access to the conditioned air hose (8) and the electrical connector (1). (6) Loosen the clamp (7) and remove the conditioned air hose (8) from the skirting lining panel flange (9). (7) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). (8) Remove the LH wardrobe (2). K. LH Wardrobe with Shroud - Removal (Figure 404) SUBTASK 020-015-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR (1) Remove the emergency equipment from the LH wardrobe (2). (2) Remove the shroud (5) with the screws (3) and washers (4). (3) Remove the sidewall fitting covers (14) with the screws (15). (4) Remove the bolts (16) and washers (17) that attach the LH wardrobe (2) to the sidewall track (13). (5) Remove the bolts (6) and washers (7) that attach the LH wardrobe (2) to the track engage fitting assemblies (9) on the floor track (8). CAUTION: THE STEP BELOW MUST BE DONE WITH CARE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE CONDITIONED AIR HOSE (11) AND THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR (1). (6) Lightly move the LH wardrobe (2) to the aisle to get access to the conditioned air hose (11) and the electrical connector (1). (7) Loosen the clamp (10) and remove the conditioned air hose (11) from the skirting lining panel flange (12). (8) Disconnect the electrical connector (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-804-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 11 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (9) Remove the LH wardrobe (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-804-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 12 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-04-400-804-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH WARDROBE OPTION 2 5. LH WARDROBE OPTION 2 - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the LH wardrobe option 2. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION TEMPERATURE CONTROL SYSTEM - OPERATION- AMM TASK 21-60-00-700-801-A/500 AL CHECK AMM TASK 25-27-05-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-21-00-700-801-A/500 PASSENGER CABIN LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL TEST READING AND ATTENDANT CALL LIGHTS (1) - OP- AMM TASK 33-25-00-700-801-A/500 ERATIONAL TEST AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK AIRSTAIRS MAIN DOOR WARNING MESSAGE - OP- AMM TASK 52-73-00-700-801-A/500 ERATIONALLY CHECK SRM 51-20-01 - C. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. LH Wardrobe - Installation (Figure 403) SUBTASK 420-014-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH SIDE-HINGED MAIN DOOR (1) Remove the sealant residues (SRM 51-20-01) from the related area. (2) Put the LH wardrobe (2) in position. (3) Connect the electrical connector (1). (4) Attach the conditioned air hose (8) to the skirting lining panel flange (9) with the clamp (7). (5) Put the LH wardrobe (2) in its installation position. (6) Attach the LH wardrobe (2) to the sidewall track (10) with the bolts (13) and washers (14). (7) Attach the LH wardrobe (2) to the track engage fitting assemblies (6) on the floor track (5) with the bolts (3) and washers (4). (8) Install the sidewall fitting covers (11) with the screws (12). (9) Install the emergency equipment into the LH wardrobe (2). (10) Apply the sealant in the forward portion of the LH wardrobe (SRM 51-20-01). J. LH Wardrobe with Shroud - Installation (Figure 404) SUBTASK 420-015-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR (1) Remove the sealant residues (SRM 51-20-01) from the related area. (2) Put the LH wardrobe (2) in position. (3) Connect the electrical connector (1). (4) Attach the conditioned air hose (11) to the skirting lining panel flange (12) with the clamp (10). (5) Put the LH wardrobe (2) in its installation position. (6) Attach the LH wardrobe (2) to the sidewall track (13) with the bolts (16) and washers (17). (7) Attach the LH wardrobe (2) to the track engage fitting assemblies (9) on the floor track (8) with the bolts (6) and washers (7). (8) Install the sidewall fitting covers (14) with the screws (15). (9) Install the shroud (5) with the screws (3) and washers (4). (10) Install the emergency equipment into the LH wardrobe (2). (11) Apply the sealant in the forward portion of the LH wardrobe (SRM 51-20-01). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-804-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 16 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-009-A (1) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ATTD-POSITION tag from the air conditioning/ pneumatic control panel, installed on the overhead panel. (2) Close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (3) On the overhead panel, set the EMERG LT switch to ARM position and remove the DO-NOT-MOVE-FROM-OFF tag from it. (4) Do an operational test of the emergency lights ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). (5) Do an operational test of the attendant call and the passenger service units (PSUs) ( AMM TASK 33-25-00-700-801-A/500). (6) Do an operational test of the cabin lights ( AMM TASK 33-21-00-700-801-A/500). (7) Do an operational test of the cabin temperature control ( AMM TASK 21-60-00-700-801-A/500). (8) Do an operational test of the main door internal control panel ( AMM TASK 52-73-00-700-801-A/500) (except for aircraft with side-hinged main door installed). (9) Install the main door curtain (AMM TASK 25-27-05-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-804-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-04 Page 17 of 17 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
